file_content.text: I know what you're thinking, but don't worry, I'm not going to say it's cold.
I sense a lot of apathy and disgruntlement. The morale of Imperial forces here is as low as the temperature.
I'm betting spilled blood freezes before it hits the ice here. I look forward to finding out firsthand.
The cold does not affect me.
Nothing but snow for kilometers either way, and I already can't feel my toes. Whose idea was it to come here again?
And to think, I used to love snow. Just one look out here, and I've already had enough.
You brought us to the wrong planet, agent. There's nothing here worth having.
Breathe deeply, here. There is great beauty on this world... along with keen discomfort.
What exceptionally bracing weather this planet has. The fresh air will be good for both of us.
Brrr. I knew it'd be cold, but I lost feeling in my feet just on the shuttle down....
Just so we're clear, frostbite still counts as death and dismemberment so far as our work agreement goes... knew I should have worn a thicker coat....
Cold. Didn't join up to let the weather do me in.
Did I ever tell you I have a fear of freezing to death?
I have reinforcements ready if we need them, my lord. Just say the word.
Thinking of throwing a grenade just to warm things up a bit.
All your industry won't prolong your lives.
It's a little warmer by the pipes, I think. Looks like someone's pumping geothermal energy.
I remember seeing a pipeline like this as a child on my homeworld. We used it to pump geothermal energy to the surface.
Got a ways to go before we hit the next shelter. Hope you're ready for this.
How long before these structures are buried in the snow? The Empire is strong--but planets are strong, as well.
The monthly maintenance required by this equipment could support a small moon. The military is taking this push seriously.
I can't imagine trying to build something like that out here.
They're trying to pump heat from under the ice. Go figure, I'd have thought this place was frozen to the core.
Good landmark, should keep our bearings. Get lost out here, that's it.
Look at the size of that place! Who built that thing?
Hmm, clearly man-made structure. Fanatics of some kind to build that out of ice.
Look at that thing. Crazy to be out there stacking ice. It doesn't even have a roof!
A tower of ice.
Leave it to the brotherhood to open shop in the biggest hunk of ice on the planet. Subtlety never was their thing.
So that's the brotherhood ice fortress. I wonder how these outcroppings are formed. I doubt the pirates built them themselves.
What sort of freaks build a fortress out of ice? Listen to me--pirates like cash and comfort, they don't do this....
A palace, crafted from ice. Perhaps we're too quick to judge these pirates.
I don't think that structure was built by the Republic. But I'm surprised pirates would be so enterprising.
Would you look at that glacial peak? It's like a--like a big tooth or something. I don't think that's natural.
Get a load of that peak. It's a little too even, like somebody shaped it. I've heard of ice sculpting, but that's taking it a bit far.
See that? The spike, in the distance. Some kind of ice fortress. Wonder who made it?
Pirate vault. This is what I've been waiting for.
I suspect there will be more dangers ahead, my lord. The pirates will doubtlessly have defenses.
Rest is for the weak. Think we're past the worst of it. Let's press on.
Come out of your hiding places, little pirates.
These guys call themselves pirates. They should be out in space, cut free. Not hiding in ice caves.
Do you think these are friends of Andronikos? I can imagine him living in a cave.
We've gone through a lot of garbage to get here. Now it's payday.
Storybook characters raid pirate vaults. Now, so do we.
The White Maw is very serious about their security. I advise caution.
I know they're shut down, but these droids are giving me the creeps. I feel like we're being watched.
Well, that's not suspicious. Look, I don't exactly see a security network, but I'm not taking my chances.
Don't like the look of this. Got "trap" written all over it.
All right, that's it, I tried not to say anything, but bantha poo, it's freezing!
All ships, no matter how big and powerful, eventually fall. A lesson for us all.
That is one bantha of a ship carcass. Bet the impact when it crashed was an amazing sight.
The carcass of a great ship. Death claims all.
The Star of Coruscant. Always wondered what happened to her. Spent a week in her brig once. Wish I'd been the one to shoot her down.
The Star of Coruscant. So this is what happened to it. It had a crew of over a thousand. I'd be surprised if any survived.
It's one big ship, I'll give you that. Probably crack a planet with that thing.
It must have been massive. No surprise the Republic wants it back.
I remember the reports coming in from Hoth during the war. I was at headquarters when the Republic superdreadnaught went down... the whole room cheered.
Oh, wow. That has to be the dreadnaught... look at the size of it. It must be covering a few kilometers of the planet's surface!
There she is. The Star of Coruscant. I'm surprised there's so much intact. Can you imagine what it took to bring that baby down?
Phew. Ship worth fighting for alright. Never fly again though, couldn't... could it?
T7 = regretting not upgrading anti-freeze systems
If you mashed Hoth together with Tatooine, would it make a decent planet with nice weather?
I left Balmorra for this frozen wasteland? What was I thinking?
Must endure cold, for Herald and hunt.
What? No sip of brandy before we set out into the cold?
Quiet. Stark. Beautiful. Whole planet is an empty page.
Cold air feels good on Bowdaar's fur.
You're sure you need me in the frozen wasteland? I could do so much more from the ship.
Hoth. Beautiful desolation. A fitting test of a warrior's survival.
Be sure to take all precautions against hypothermia outlined in Service Manual chapter four.
These desolate conditions do nothing to dampen my resolve! Lead on, sir!
Ice and snow, as far as you can see. I can't tell you how glad I am to be here, boss.
Frozen geysers = evidence of underground hot zones // Jedi + T7 = find them?
All right, Hoth isn't all bad. This area right here? Kinda pretty.
Hot geysers, frozen solid. That's how you know a planet's too cold.
Ha. Hoth has teeth.
These ice formations inspired Gerrut's theory of tertiary volition. Obvious, now that I see them in person.
Frozen geysers. Beauty from chaos. Always where you least expect it.
Wow, look at that. The geysers froze mid-burst. Isn't that something?
Frozen geysers. That's something you don't see often. Thankfully.
Impressive. Nature itself is no match for Hoth.
Hmm. Frozen geysers would be my guess. Quite a sight out here in the middle of nowhere.
Formations resulting from the flash-freezing of surface geysers. No tactical significance.
Nice. Looks like shrapnel from a big, icy grenade.
T7 = requesting hot oil bath post-mission
Just when you think you've seen every form of ice on Hoth, somebody has to go and build a fortress out of it.
You see that giant tower out there? That can't be a natural formation.
Is strange formation there. Or, was built.
Of all the things to build your castle from. Ice.
There. Someone's stronghold.
That ice tower looks man-made. What lunatics had the time for that project?
Let me guess: We're going to wind up at the ice fortress? Knowing you, it's inevitable.
That tower in the distance is an invitation to battle. We should answer the call.
I don't think that buildup is a natural formation, sir.
The feature in front of us did not occur naturally!
What is that supposed to be? Looks like a building.
Pirates = clever hiding place // Jedi + T7 = more clever
Hoth. If the cold doesn't kill you, the pointy landscape will.
Could be worse. This cave could be full of man-eating wampas. It's not, right?
Have seen ice stalactites cut men in half.
When we get back, I'm finding those designs for a centrally heated coat. If you insist on trekking across this snowball, I can at least be comfortable.
Careful. Ice stalactites might come loose. Sharp as razors.
Bowdaar smells many pirates.
I am officially tired of all this ice. Think I'll take out my anger on the local pirate population.
The pirates are cowards for hiding in these holes. They will learn the error of their ways.
There's no telling what kind of defenses the pirates might have built in here--watch for blind corners and ambushes.
Pirates, Imperials--anyone who strikes at the Republic will face swift justice!
Charging into a pirate base instead of an Imp base--should be a nice change of pace.
T7 + Jedi = need a vacation // Location = anyplace warm
Look at the size of that thing. No wonder everyone's fighting over it.
That's one monster of a starship. Too bad it's a wreck.
Ship could hold every clan ever hatched, and every prey they hunted.
Whoever built that ship wasn't shy.
Republic hubris. Always overbuilding their ships.
Is that a starship, or did someone break off a piece of Coruscant?
Wouldn't you love to salvage that thing? Has to be worth a fortune.
You should upgrade your starship to one like that--preferably a version that flies.
The Star of Coruscant. One of the most powerful ships the Republic ever designed. They just don't build 'em like they used to.
The Star of Coruscant. I never thought I'd actually see it in person.
The Star of Coruscant. A landmark of Republic engineering--such a waste!
Praise: You are wise to bring me, master. Unlike soft organics, I am not intimidated by cold.
Rumination: This geothermal station could provide enough heat to melt this ice shelf, if improperly directed.
Alert: Be cautious, master. Any undesirable who would sculpt a fortress like that is likely insane.
Insult: A pirate vault. How quaint. Perhaps we will find rare treasures and make it worth the effort.
Reverie: Oh, to command such a vessel, master. Think of the potential liquidations. Whole planets, wiped clean for the Maker.
Reassurance: Fear not, master--sub-freezing temperatures do not impair my functionality.
Observation: Impressive natural structures--highly useful for pinning down troublemakers.
Reflection: Consider the insanity that drove troublemakers to build such a place. I look forward to deleting them.
Announcement: I am composing an opera, master. I call it "Deleting Pirates Under the Ice." It's a tragedy--for them.
Truism: Your Republic must remember to keep its dreadnaughts in space where they belong.
